cookies.title: We use cookies
cookies.description: We use cookies to enhance your browsing experience, provide personalised content, and analyse our traffic. By clicking "Accept All", you consent to our use of cookies.

preferences.title: Cookie Preferences
preferences.description: We use different types of cookies to optimise your experience on our website. You can choose which categories you want to allow.

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.description: These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms.

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies
analytics.description: These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting and reporting information anonymously. We use Google Analytics to improve our website performance.

marketing.title: Marketing Cookies
marketing.description: These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites.

functional.title: Functional Cookies
functional.description: These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third-party providers whose services we have added to our pages.

hero.title: Advanced Materials & Infrastructure Solutions
hero.subtitle: For over three decades, Rosehill has led the way in engineering advanced materials that protect, connect and perform in the world's toughest environments.

ourStory.title: Engineering Excellence Since 1988
ourStory.paragraph1: The modern world's infrastructure and materials challenges require solutions that deliver both performance and environmental responsibility. Operating from our UK headquarters in Sowerby Bridge, we've established ourselves as a global leader in advanced materials and engineered infrastructure solutions.
ourStory.paragraph2: From specialty chemicals and polymer systems to road safety and recreational surfaces, our products are trusted worldwide. By manufacturing our own polyurethane binders and controlling the entire production process, we ensure exceptional quality across our materials and infrastructure product range.

butlins.title: Butlins Skegness SKYPARK
butlins.description: SKYPARK is a breathtaking project on England's picturesque east coast, featuring an exhilarating playground accessible to all children with imposing climbing towers, intricate tunnels, slides, and the UK's longest interactive seesaw.

challenge.title: Creative Design Challenge
challenge.description1: Butlins required a vibrant, engaging play surface that could withstand heavy use from thousands of children during peak holiday periods. Our TPV granule system was customised with 12 distinct colour zones, creating themed areas throughout the adventure playground.
challenge.description2: The installation incorporated critical fall height zones around climbing equipment, with varying depths of safety surfacing to meet EN 1177 standards. Special attention was paid to drainage and accessibility requirements for wheelchair users.

performance.title: Performance & Safety
performance.description: The surface has performed exceptionally through two full seasons, maintaining its vibrant colours and safety properties despite constant use. Independent safety testing confirms continued compliance with all playground safety standards.

quote.text: SKYPARK at Butlins Skegness is an exhilarating playground accessible to all children, featuring imposing climbing towers, intricate tunnels, slides, and the UK's longest interactive seesaw. The playground transforms with vibrant LEDs as the sun sets, ensuring the fun continues well into the night.
quote.attribution: â€” Project delivered by Abacus Playgrounds using Rosehill TPVÂ® blends

moko.title: MOKO Park Adventure Playground
moko.description: Large adventure playground installation at Hong Kong's MOKO shopping centre, featuring climbing frames and balancing platforms with Rosehill TPVÂ® safety surfacing and cultural design elements inspired by nearby Flower and Bird Markets.

nyc.title: Northern Blvd Cycle Safety Project
nyc.description: Protected cycle route installation using Narrow Cycle Lane Defenders and Lane Separators to create safe segregated travel for cyclists in Queens.
nyc.client: Client: New York Department of Transportation

background.title: Project Background
background.description1: Vehicles regularly exceeded speed limits on the busy Northern Blvd in Queens, with cyclists feeling unsafe when using the roads due to common incidents. NYC was committed to creating an integrated and mobile community where cyclists feel safe.
background.description2: The solution involved segregating the cycle lane using surface-mounted Narrow Cycle Lane Defenders and creating sections of continuous segregation using substantial Lane Separators. Both products are kerb height and incorporate high-visibility bollards for enhanced safety.

results.title: Results & Impact
results.description: Vehicle incursions into cycle lanes have been completely eliminated since installation. Cyclist confidence has measurably increased, with the protected route now safely accommodating both traditional cyclists and rental e-scooters. Speed-related incidents in the corridor have significantly decreased.

quote.text: This project demonstrates how strategic placement of physical barriers can transform high-traffic corridors. The Northern Boulevard installation has become a model for similar cycling infrastructure improvements across NYC, extending from Queens to Rockaway Parkway South of Flatlands Ave.
quote.attribution: â€” Project delivered by NYC Department of Transportation

saudi.title: King Abdulaziz Airport Speed Management
saudi.description: Custom Speed Calmers installation at Jeddah's international airport to reduce vehicle speeds at access points with minimal operational disruption.

requirements.title: Project Requirements
requirements.description1: High vehicle speeds posed significant safety risks at airport access points. Traditional concrete speed calming solutions were not feasible due to prolonged installation times and disruption. A solution was required that could be quickly implemented and easily removed if necessary.
requirements.description2: Speed Calmers were chosen for their proven effectiveness and suitability for high-traffic areas like airports. The modular design allowed for quick installation, significantly reducing downtime and airport operational impact.

results.title: Results & Benefits
results.description: Immediate reduction in vehicle speeds significantly enhanced road safety around the airport. Minimal disruption during installation, with Speed Calmers implemented efficiently without affecting airport operations. The recycled and recyclable product contributed to the airport's sustainability goals.

quote.text: Speed Calmers were custom-fitted to specific road widths at the airport, ensuring seamless integration with existing infrastructure. The pre-fabricated, modular design enabled quick installation with minimal disruption to airport operations, while providing an immediate reduction in vehicle speeds and enhanced road safety.
quote.attribution: â€” Project delivered by Mensi Est for Jeddah Airports Company

guildford.title: Guildford Network Rail Depot Walkways
guildford.description: Safe pedestrian walkway installation at Network Rail maintenance depot using 25 Walkway Panels, demonstrating superior efficiency over traditional methods.

efficiency.title: Installation Efficiency Comparison
efficiency.description1: The project compared Rosehill Walkway Panels with traditional GRP and wooden framing methods. The Rosehill panels installation took only half a day with just two labourers, while the GRP panels took three days with five labourers.
efficiency.description2: Follow-up visits found the walkway panels maintaining their integrity perfectly, while wooden framing for the GRP panels was already showing signs of deterioration. The recycled rubber construction provided a durable and low-maintenance alternative.

performance.title: Long-term Performance
performance.description: The installation showcased Rosehill Walkway Panels as an innovative solution within the Network Rail network, demonstrating significantly reduced labour requirements and superior durability compared to conventional methods.

quote.text: "The efficiency and ease of installation of the Rosehill panels was remarkable. We've seen excellent performance while the traditional wooden alternatives are already deteriorating."

metrolinx.title: Metrolinx Rail Network Safety Enhancement
metrolinx.description: Large-scale Anti-Trespass Panel deployment across Canada's rail network to reduce unauthorized access and improve safety for commuters and residents.

climate.title: Winter Climate Engineering
climate.description1: Toronto's extreme winter conditions demanded specialised polymer formulations capable of maintaining structural integrity at -40Â°C. Our anti-trespass panels were engineered with enhanced cold-weather compounds and flexible mounting systems to accommodate thermal expansion.
climate.description2: Installation was completed during Toronto's harsh winter months, requiring specialised cold-weather installation procedures and equipment. The project team worked closely with TTC operations to minimise service disruption across three major transit lines.

effectiveness.title: Security Effectiveness
effectiveness.description: The anti-trespass system achieved a 95% reduction in unauthorized track access incidents within the first six months. The visual deterrent effect, combined with physical barriers, has significantly improved operational safety and service reliability.

quote.text: A total of 7,656 Anti-Trespass Panels were installed across high-risk areas and key access points where trespassing incidents were most frequent. The unique conical stud design created an uncomfortable walking surface, effectively deterring unauthorized individuals from crossing while integrating seamlessly with existing infrastructure.
quote.attribution: â€” Project delivered by LB Foster for Metrolinx

pembroke.title: Pembroke Rail Drainage System
pembroke.description: Rosehill Drainage System installation with curved drainage path and bedrock constraints, achieving target discharge rate for rail infrastructure water management.

challenges.title: Installation Challenges
challenges.description1: Extensive bedrock severely limited drainage depth and installation options. Existing telecommunications infrastructure required careful navigation, while the curved drainage path needed to direct water towards the tunnel entrance within tight timeframe constraints.
challenges.description2: The Rosehill Drainage System was installed with 1-in-20 gradient on 75mm pea gravel bed, with units stepped to overcome additional bedrock encounters. Units were cut at 90-degree angles to maintain drainage run, with 50mm Rosehill Drainage System tiles protecting the base trough from sediment build-up.

results.title: Successful Results
results.description: The system achieved the target discharge rate of 42 litres per second, successfully adapted to site constraints without compromising performance, and completed installation within time restrictions, demonstrating the system's versatility in challenging rail environments.

quote.text: "The Rosehill Drainage System proved how the system can overcome challenges we encounter on site regularly. The ability to cut and step the units without impacting performance was extremely useful under a time-restricted install."

moreton.title: Moreton Rosehill Drainage System Performance Trial
moreton.description: Comprehensive hydraulic testing of Rosehill Drainage System at National Highways Test Centre, simulating extreme weather conditions including 1-in-1000-year storm events.

research.title: Research & Development
research.description1: The Moreton trial represented a unique collaboration between Rosehill, the Environment Agency, and leading universities to develop next-generation sustainable drainage technology. The installation incorporated advanced monitoring systems to track performance in real-world conditions.
research.description2: The trial site featured multiple drainage configurations, allowing direct comparison of performance characteristics. Automated monitoring systems recorded flow rates, water quality parameters, and system maintenance requirements over 18 months of operation.

results.title: Breakthrough Results
results.description: The trial demonstrated an 85% improvement in water quality metrics compared to conventional drainage, with significant reductions in suspended solids, hydrocarbons, and heavy metals. These results have informed new industry standards and best practices.

quote.text: The trial installation comprised a 60-metre modular roadside filter drain along a 16-metre-wide, four-lane carriageway. The system demonstrated efficient management of both controlled and extreme water flows, with no surcharging or flooding observed during testing, including a simulated 1-in-1000-year storm event with 11,000 litres of water discharge.
quote.attribution: â€” Trial conducted by Rosehill Polymers with Civil Water Management Ltd and National Highways
